thread.title: Apollo’s McGraw-Hill Education Files for Initial Offering
thread.title_full: Apollo’s McGraw-Hill Education Files for Initial Offering - Bloomberg Business

author: Elizabeth Wollman
title: Apollo’s McGraw-Hill Education Files for Initial Offering
text:
McGraw-Hill Education Inc., the educational publisher bought by Apollo Global Management for $2.4 billion in March 2013, filed for an initial public offering in the U.S.
The company used a $100 million placeholder, an amount used to calculate registration fees that may change, in a filing Friday with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commision.
McGraw-Hill Education didn’t indicate which exchange it will apply to be listed on after the offering. It plans to use the symbol MHED. No banks were named in the filing.
McGraw-Hill Cos. sold the company to Apollo in 2013 and subsequently changed its name to McGraw Hill Financial Inc.
